Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, interior spotted with off-white granular deposit, exterior covered with a cream-buff slip with one incised line and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 36 (but there with a first line giving date year 10[+x?].)
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393139) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393139)
